title: Oracle Java ICC Profile MultiLanguage 'mluc' Tag Parsing Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of java. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page.
The specific flaw exists within the way Java handles color profiles. When parsing a color profile containing a invalid MultiLanguage 'mluc' tag it is possible to cause an integer to wrap during an arithmetic operation. This new value is used to allocate memory on the heap. A remote attacker can abuse the faulty code to execute code under the context of the user running the browser.
addtionnal_details: Oracle has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/javacpujune2011-313339.html
timeline:
2011-01-21 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2011-06-08 - Coordinated public release of advisory
